result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P Olle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court granted payment plan upon completion of application form at Clerk of Court's Office.  If defendant fails to complete application, financial obligations will be due within 60 days.  Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 owed for contempt of court.  ($75 per mo pay plan)

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
May transfer to Portage County if accepted by Sheriff of both counties.
AMENDED 8/4/2015: report date changed to 8/21/2015 at 6pm.
